title: RuPaul drops $20 million on elegant Beverly Hills mansion
text:
RuPaul has purchased an opulent European-style estate in Beverly Hills for $AU 20.18 millions ($US 13.7 million), an appropriately glamorous home for the world’s most famous drag queen.

Its imposing columned entryway looms from its hillside perch and a set of showy front steps.

A trust for RuPaul Charles, creator and producer of reality-TV hit “RuPaul’s Drag Race,” closed on the new digs in late September, property records show.

The TV personality, 58, born RuPaul Andre Charles, placed his fabulous but smaller midcentury modern abode on the market in July for $US 5 million. After a price drop to $4.7 million in August, that home has been taken off the market.

Completed in 1991, RuPaul’s palatial new six-bedroom house spans over almost 1,000 sqm.

The interiors feature double-height ceilings across much of the first floor, including a dramatic marble-tiled entryway.

Same goes for the spacious dining room, which is flooded with light from a trifecta of soaring glass French doors.

Elaborate moulding, fireplaces and intricately patterned French parquet floors add to the home’s regal European vibe.

There are also all of the add-ons one comes to expect from a Beverly Hills mansion, including a wine cellar, home gym and media room.

The private back terrace — lined in tall hedges — features a regency-style pool with a spa and elegant gazebo.

Mr. Charles cut a deal on his new abode, coming in after the home received numerous price cuts. It originally listed a year ago asking a hair below $US 20 million.

A major upgrade for the star, the luxurious home underscores the success of the entertainer’s self-titled TV series, which just expanded its drag competitions with a U.K. launch this week.

The new home is more than triple the size of a modest house he’s owned in West Hollywood since 2011.
description: One of the world’s most famous drag queens has upgraded big time in LA, dropping $20 million on this glamourous European-style estate in Beverly Hills.
